Translations.Text: The beneficent
taught the Quran
created the human being
taught him the speech
The sun and the moon with precisely calculated (courses)
The herb (or the star) and the tree both humble themselves (before Him)
And He raised the sky and set up the balance
that you do not outdo the balance
And perform the weighing with justice and do not make the scale light
And He set up the earth for the human race
in it there are fruits and palm trees having coverings
and the seed having outer shell, and the fragrant herbs
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
He created the human being from dried clay like pottery clay
And He created the Jinn from flame of a fire
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Master of the two easts and Master of the two wests
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
He made the two seas flow freely to meet
there is a barrier between them that they do not go beyond
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Pearl and coral comes out of both of them
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
And the sailing ships raised in the sea like the mountains/road signs belong to Him
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Everyone on it (the earth) is mortal
while your Master's essence, having the majesty and the nobility remains (forever)
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Everyone in the skies and on the earth ask Him (for their needs). Every day He is in some affair
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
We are going to attend to you, the two important beings (humans and Jinn)
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
You, group of Jinn and humans, if you can cross the boundaries of the skies and the earth then cross. You cannot cross except with an authorization
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
A flame of fire and melted copper will be sent upon both of you, and you cannot help/defend yourselves
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
And when the sky splits and it becomes red like the red rawhide (or red hot oil)
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
On that day no human being or Jinn is asked about his sin
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
The guilty ones are recognized by their appearance, then they are taken by (the hair lock of) the forehead and the feet
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
This is hell that the guilty ones deny it
They go around between it and between hot boiling water
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
And there are two gardens for anyone who fears his Master’s position
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Two (gardens) having a variety (of trees)
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
There are two springs flowing in both of them
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
There are pairs of every fruits in both of them
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Leaning on cushions/beds inside of which is from heavy silk, and fruits of the two gardens are within reach
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
And there are girls with restrained glances in them whom no human being or Jinn had sex with them before them
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
They are like the ruby and the coral
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Is reward of the goodness anything except goodness
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
And beside those two are two (other) gardens
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Both dark green (because of lush vegetation)
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
There are two springs gushing out in both of them
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
There are fruits and date and pomegranate in both of them
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
There are good and beautiful females in both of them
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Appealing girls restricted in the pavilions
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
No human being or Jinn had sex with them before them
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Leaning on green pillows and fine colorful carpets
Then which of your Master’s favors do you deny
Blessed is the name of your Master, having the majesty and the nobility
